choices.A: A computing device that manages cryptography, decrypts traffic, and maintains library calls
choices.D: A computing device that manages algorithms, performs entropy functions, and maintains digital signatures
choices.C: A computing device that manages physical keys, encrypts devices, and creates strong cryptographic functions
choices.B: A computing device that manages digital keys, performs encryption/decryption functions, and maintains other cryptographic functions

comments.content: Agree. B is correct. Thanks for the context

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
HSM stands for Hardware Security Module. An HSM is a dedicated computing device that is designed to provide secure storage and management of cryptographic keys and other sensitive data. HSMs are designed to provide a secure environment for the generation, storage, and use of cryptographic keys, as well as the execution of cryptographic operations such as encryption and decryption. This secure environment is necessary to protect the keys from theft or unauthorized access and to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of sensitive data. By offloading cryptographic functions to an HSM, organizations can improve the security of their data and reduce the risk of security incidents.

Selected Answer: B
A Hardware Security Module (HSM) is a dedicated, tamper-resistant hardware device that is used to safeguard and manage cryptographic keys and perform secure cryptographic operations. HSMs are designed to provide a high level of security and protection for cryptographic materials and sensitive data. They offer the following key features:

questions.question_text: Which of the following BEST describes HSM?

comments.content: Agree. This is 100% a supply chain issue.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Coordinate a supply chain assessment to ensure hardware authenticity is the BEST course of action to mitigate the risk of physically altered motherboards reoccurring. This will involve thoroughly examining and verifying the authenticity of the components and products in the supply chain, from the manufacturers to the distributors and suppliers, to ensure that no malicious changes have been made to the hardware during the manufacturing process.

Selected Answer: C
Discovering physically altered motherboards during the manufacturing process is a significant security concern, as it could indicate potential supply chain attacks or tampering. To mitigate the risk of this recurring, the organization should take the following steps:

choices.B: Conduct a trade study to determine if the additional risk constitutes further action.
choices.A: Perform an assessment of the firmware to determine any malicious modifications.
choices.C: Coordinate a supply chain assessment to ensure hardware authenticity
choices.D: Work with IT to replace the devices with the known-altered motherboards.

questions.question_text: An organization discovers motherboards within the environment that appear to have been physically altered during the manufacturing process. Which of the following is the BEST course of action to mitigate the risk of this reoccurring?

comments.content: Agreed. In this case, Dig is being used to retrieve the TXT record associated with the DKIM selector for the domain "comptia.org". The result should return any TXT records that are associated with the DKIM selector for the domain, which can then be used to verify the authenticity of email messages sent from that domain.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The analyst is validating the presence of a DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) record in the domain's DNS (Domain Name System) using the dig command. The DKIM record is stored in the TXT resource record under the "_domainkey" subdomain for the specified domain. The analyst is verifying the presence of the DKIM record to ensure that the email security feature is functioning properly and the organization is protected against phishing attacks. The DKIM record is used to verify the authenticity of emails by ensuring that the message was not altered during transit and that it was actually sent by the domain specified in the "From" header.

Selected Answer: B
Answer is b
https://www.cyberciti.biz/faq/unix-linux-test-and-validate-dnssec-using-dig-command-line/

Selected Answer: C
They mention : "a few email security technologies in the last year:"
SPF, DMARC and DKIM are all TXT DNS records and are all email security methods.

DMARC is an email authentication method built on top of DKIM and SPF.
I will go with DMARC on this one.

A sender policy framework (SPF) record is a type of DNS TXT record that lists all the servers authorized to send emails from a particular domain. 

A DKIM record is really a DNS TXT ("text") record containing the public key of the sender

DMARC is an email authentication method built on top of DKIM and SPF. DMARC describes what to do with an email that fails SPF and DKIM. Together, SPF, DKIM, and DMARC help prevent email spam and email spoofing. 
Like DKIM records, DMARC policies are stored as DNS TXT records.
A DMARC record stores a domain's DMARC policy. DMARC records are stored in the Domain Name System (DNS) as DNS TXT records. 

Refrences: https://www.cloudflare.com/learning/dns/dns-records/dns-dkim-record/

Selected Answer: D
the dkim selector was used

questions.question_text:
A security analyst is reviewing a suspected phishing campaign that has targeted an organization. The organization has enabled a few email security technologies in the last year: however, the analyst believes the security features are not working. The analyst runs the following command:

> dig domain._domainkey.comptia.org TXT

Which of the following email protection technologies is the analyst MOST likely validating?

choices.A: enables remote code execution that is being exploited in the wild.
choices.B: enables data leakage but is not known to be in the environment.
choices.D: affected the organization in the past but was probably contained and eradicated.
choices.C: enables lateral movement and was reported as a proof of concept.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. enables remote code execution that is being exploited in the wild.

A vulnerability that enables remote code execution that is being actively exploited in the wild should be disseminated first, as it presents an immediate risk to the organization and its systems. The other vulnerabilities may also be important, but they are less likely to pose an immediate threat, so they can be prioritized lower.

comments.content: Agree. Thanks for the link to more discussions.

questions.question_text: A cybersecurity analyst is reading a daily intelligence digest of new vulnerabilities. The type of vulnerability that should be disseminated FIRST is one that:

comments.content: Agreed. B, Data Masking is correct here.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Data masking refers to the process of obscuring specific data fields within a database, making it unidentifiable while still preserving its original format, structure, and meaning for testing or development purposes. The developer's script to make names and other PII data unidentifiable before loading into the testing system is an example of data masking as the original data is being transformed to protect sensitive information while still retaining its usefulness for testing purposes.

questions.question_text: A developer wrote a script to make names and other PII data unidentifiable before loading a database export into the testing system. Which of the following describes the type of control that is being used?
